ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.2_0: Now at that time Venerable Dabba the Mallian was realised when he came to perfection.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.3_0: He had realized all there is to be realized by a disciple
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.4_0: and had nothing further to do.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.5_0: While he was in seclusion he reflected on this,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.6_0: “I’ve attained all that can be attained by a disciple,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.7_0: I’ve attained all that can be attained by me
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.8_0: and I have nothing more to do.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.9_0: and he thought, “How may I be of service to the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.11_0: Perhaps I could assign dwellings for the Sangha and designate the meals?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.1_0: In the evening Dabba came out of retreat and went to the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.3_0: “Venerable Sir, while I was in seclusion I reflected that I’ve attained all that can be attained by a disciple, and I was wondering how I might be of service to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.5_0: ‘Why don’t I assign dwellings for the Sangha and designate the meals?’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.6_0: I wish to prepare a meal for the Sangha and designate the meals.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.1_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.2_0: “The Sangha should appoint Dabba the Mallian as the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.3_0: And this is how he should be appointed.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.5_0: and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.6_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.7_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should appoint Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.9_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.10_0: The Sangha appoints Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.11_0: Any monk who approves of appointing Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.12_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.13_0: The Sangha has appointed Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.14_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.1_0: Dabba assigned dwellings to the monks according to their character.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.2_0: He assigned dwellings in the same place to those monks who were experts on the discourse, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.4_0: And he did likewise for the experts on the Monastic Law, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.6_0: for the expounders of the Teaching, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.7_0: “These ones will listen to the teaching!”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.10_0: and for the gossips and the body-builders, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.11_0: “In this way even these venerables will be happy.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.12_0: When monks arrived at night, he entered the fire element and assigned dwellings with the help of that light.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.13_0: Monks even arrived late on purpose,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.14_0: “Venerable Dabba the Mallian has supernormal powers.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.15_0: They would approach Dabba and say,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.19_0: They would intentionally suggest somewhere far away:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.20_0: “Please assign us a dwelling on the Vulture Peak,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.22_0: “... on Black Rock on the slope of Isigili Hill,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.23_0: “... in the Sattapaṇṇi Cave on the slope of Vebhāra Hill,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.24_0: “... in Cool Grove on the hill at the Snake’s Pool,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.30_0: “... in the deer park at Maddakucchi.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.31_0: Dabba then entered his fire element and stood in front of him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.32_0: They followed closely behind him with the help of that light.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.33_0: And he would assign them dwellings:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.34_0: “This is the bed, this the bench, this the mattress, this the pillow, this the place for defecating, this the place for urinating, this the water for drinking, this the water for washing, this the walking stick;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.35_0: these are the Sangha’s agreements concerning the right time to enter and the right time to depart.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.36_0: Dabba then returned to the Bamboo Grove.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.1_0: At that time the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka were only newly ordained. They had little merit,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.2_0: and they obtained inferior dwellings and meals.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.3_0: The people of Rājagaha were keen to give specially prepared almsfood to the senior monks—ghee, oil, and special foods—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.4_0: but to the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka they gave ordinary food of porridge and broken rice.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.5_0: After the meal, when they had returned from almsround, they asked the senior monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.6_0: “What did you get at the dining hall?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.9_0: But the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.10_0: “We didn’t get anything except ordinary food of porridge and broken rice.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.1_0: On one occasion the householder who was the meal together after the Sangha was designated a regular meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.2_0: He made his offering in the dining hall together with his wives and children.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.3_0: Some of them offered rice, others curry, others oil, and others special foods.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.4_0: On one occasion the meal to be given by this householder on the following day had been designated to the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.5_0: Just then that householder went to the monastery on some business.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.6_0: he went to venerable Dabba Mallaputta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.6_1: After approaching and worshipping Venerable Dabba the Mallian, he sat down on one side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.7_0: And Dabba instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.8_0: After the talk, he asked Dabba,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.9_0: “Venerable, who has been designated to receive tomorrow’s meal in our house?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.12_0: “Why should bad monks eat in our house?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.13_0: After returning to his house, he told a female slave,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.14_0: “For those who are coming for tomorrow’s meal, prepare seats at the gateway and serve them broken rice and porridge.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.1_0: The monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said to each other,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.2_0: “Yesterday we were designated a meal from that householder who offers fine food.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.3_0: Tomorrow he’ll serve us together with his wives and children.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.4_0: Some of them will offer us rice, others bean curry, others oil, and others special curry.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.5_0: And because they were excited, they did not sleep properly that night.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.6_0: The following morning they robed up, took their bowls and robes, and went to the house of that householder.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.7_0: When the female slave saw them coming,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.7_1: she prepared seats at the gateway and said to them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.10_0: “The meal can’t be ready, since we’re given seats at the gateway.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.11_0: She then brought them broken rice and porridge, and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.13_0: “But, Sister, we’ve come for the regular meal.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.15_0: But yesterday I was told by the head of the household to serve you like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.17_0: The monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said to each other,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.18_0: “Yesterday this householder came to the monastery and spoke with Dabba.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.19_0: Dabba must be responsible for this split between this householder and us.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.20_0: And because they were dejected, they did not eat as much as they had intended.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.21_0: After the meal they returned to the monastery, put their bowls and robes away, and sat outside the monastery gateway, using their upper robe as a back-and-knee strap. They were silent and humiliated, their shoulders drooping and their heads down, glum and speechless.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.1_0: Then the nun Mettiyā went to the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.3_0: When they said this, the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka were not able to respond.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.5_0: a third time she said the same thing,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.7_0: but they still did not respond.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.10_0: “It’s because we’ve been badly treated by Dabba the Mallian, and you’re not taking an interest.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.12_0: “If you like, you could make the Buddha expel Dabba.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.13_0: “What should I do? How am I able to do that?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.15_0: ‘Venerable Sir, this isn’t proper or appropriate.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.16_0: There’s fear, distress, and oppression in this district, where none of these should exist.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.18_0: It seems to me that water is burning,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.19_0: Venerable Dabba the Mallian has raped me.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.20_0: Saying, “Yes,” she went to the Buddha, and told him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.20_1: and after approaching and worshipping the Fortunate One, he stood on one side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.21_0: and then repeated what she had been told to say.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.22_0: what he had been told to say.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.23_0: There’s fear, distress, and oppression in this district, where none of these should exist.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.25_0: It seems to me that water is burning,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.26_0: Venerable Dabba the Mallian has raped me.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.1_0: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Dabba:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.2_0: “Dabba, do you remember doing as the nun Mettiyā says?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.5_0: and a third time the Buddha asked
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.6_0: “Dabba, do you remember doing as the nun Mettiyā says?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.8_0: He then said, “Dabba, the Dabbas don’t give such evasive answers.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.9_0: If it was done by you, say so;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.10_0: if it wasn’t done by you, then say that.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.11_0: “Sir, since I was born I don’t recall having sexual intercourse even in a dream, much less when awake.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.12_0: The Buddha said to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.13_0: “Well then, monks, expel the nun Mettiyā,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.14_0: and these monks are devoted to the path.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.15_0: The Buddha then got up from his seat and entered his dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.16_0: When the monks had expelled the nun Mettiyā,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.17_0: The monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said to them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.20_0: She was urged on by us, because we were angry, displeased, and aiming to make Dabba leave the monastic life.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.21_0: “But did you groundlessly charge Venerable Dabba with an offense entailing expulsion?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.23_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.24_0: “How can Mettiya and Bhūmajaka groundlessly charge Venerable Dabba with an offense entailing expulsion?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.25_0: They rebuked those monks in many ways and then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.26_0: “Is it true, monks, that you groundlessly charged Dabba the Mallian with an offense entailing expulsion?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.29_0: “... Foolish men, how can you groundlessly charge Dabba with an offense entailing expulsion?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.30_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.31_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.32.1_0: ‘If a monk who is angry and displeased groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, aiming to make him leave the monastic life,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.33_0: and then after some time, whether he is questioned or not, it is clear that the legal issue is unrelated and used as a pretext, and he admits to his ill will, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.8_0: upset, dissatisfied, discontent, having hatred, hostile.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.10_0: because of that upset, that ill will, that dissatisfaction, and that discontent, he is displeased.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.12_0: not seen, not heard, not suspected.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.16_0: accuses or causes to be accused.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.17_0: To make him leave the monastic life:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.18_0: to make him leave the monkhood, leave the state of an ascetic, leave his morality, leave the virtue of asceticism.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.20_0: the moment, the instant, the second after he has laid the charge.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.22_0: he is questioned about the grounds of his charge.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.24_0: if he is not corrected by anyone;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.26_0: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.27_0: And he admits to his ill will:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.28_0: “what I said was empty, what I said was false, what I said was unreal; I said it without knowing.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.29_0: He commits an offense entailing suspension:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.30_0: ... Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.1_0: Although he has not seen it, he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.2_0: “I’ve seen that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.3_0: You’re no longer an ascetic, not a son of the Sakyan;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.4_0: you’re excluded from the observance-day procedure, from the invitation procedure, from legal procedures of the Sangha,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.5_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.6_0: Although he has not heard it,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.7_0: he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.8_0: “I’ve heard that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.9_0: You’re no longer an ascetic, not a son of the Sakyan;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.10_0: you’re excluded from the observance-day procedure, from the invitation procedure, from legal procedures of the Sangha,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.11_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.12_0: Although he does not suspect it,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.13_0: he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.14_0: “I suspect that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.15_0: You’re no longer an ascetic, not a son of the Sakyan;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.16_0: you’re excluded from the observance-day procedure, from the invitation procedure, from legal procedures of the Sangha,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.17_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.1_0: Although he has not seen it, he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.2_0: “I’ve seen and I’ve heard that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.4_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.5_0: Although he has not seen it, he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.6_0: “I’ve seen and I suspect that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.8_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.9_0: Although he has not seen it, he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.10_0: “I’ve seen and I’ve heard and I suspect that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.12_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.13_0: Although he has not heard it,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.14_0: he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.17_0: I’ve heard and I suspect and I’ve seen that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.19_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.20_0: Although he does not suspect it,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.21_0: he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.24_0: I suspect and I’ve seen and I’ve heard that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.2.26_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.1_0: He has seen that someone has committed an offense entailing expulsion,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.2_0: If he then accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.3_0: “I’ve heard that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.5_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.6_0: He has seen that someone has committed an offense entailing expulsion,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.7_0: If he then accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.8_0: “I suspect that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.9_0: I’ve heard and I suspect that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.11_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.13_0: he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.14_0: If he then accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.15_0: “I suspect that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.16_0: I’ve seen that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.17_0: I suspect and I’ve seen that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.19_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.21_0: he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.22_0: If he then accuses him like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.23_0: “I’ve seen that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.24_0: I’ve heard that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.25_0: I’ve seen and I’ve heard that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.26_0: You’re no longer an ascetic, not a son of the Sakyan ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.3.27_0: For each statement, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.1.1_0: Someone is impure, but one thinks he is pure;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.1.2_0: someone is pure, but one thinks he is impure;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.1.3_0: if he regards an impure person is impure;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.1.4_0: someone is pure, but one thinks he is pure;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.1_0: An impure person has committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.2_0: If one regards him as pure, but then, without having obtained his permission, speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.3_0: An impure person has committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.4_0: If one regards him as pure, but then, having obtained his permission, speaks with the aim of making him leave the monastic life, one commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.5_0: An impure person has committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.6_0: If one regards him as pure, but then, without having obtained his permission, speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits one offense for abusive speech and one offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.7_0: An impure person has committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.2.8_0: If one regards him as pure, but then, having obtained his permission, speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.3.1_0: A pure person has not committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.3.2_0: If one regards him as impure, and then, without having obtained his permission, speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits one offense for abusive speech and one offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.3.3_0: A pure person has not committed an offense entailing expulsion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.3.4_0: If one regards him as impure, and then, having obtained his permission, speaks with the aim of abusing him, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.3.5_0: A pure person has not committed an offense entailing expulsion.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.3.8_0: If one regards him as impure, and then, having obtained his permission, speaks with the aim of abusing him, one commits an offense for abusive speech.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:4.5.13_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on groundless, is finished.
